name: RIad Al Loune

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We absolutely loved the Riad and cannot recommend it highly enough. We stayed from 31st October - 8th November 2012 for our belated Honeymoon. We didn't want to leave. A warm welcome, beautiful arcitecture and stunning decoration, the cleanest rooms and all amenties you could want: fresh, fluffly towels, cotton buds, shampoo/ conditioner, hairdryer. Complimentary water and fruits in room. Beautiful breakfast, all 'homemade' at the Riad. Spa treatments available at extra cost if required. Most importantly the staff: Khadija, the Manageress, Youssef, Latifa & Zeineb. All lovely people, who work incredibly hard. Could not have been more welcoming. They cannot do enough to help you and will assist in anyway they can to ensure your trip to Marrakech is everything you hoped for and more. We will definitely return!
reviews.title: A paradise in the heart of Marrakech!

reviews.text: Riad al Loune might very well be the best hotel I have ever stayed at. You might find places with more stars or a bigger pool, but it is hard to imagine you will find a place with better service than what Khadija, Youssef and Latifa offers here. They are amazing! We have stayed here for a week and enjoyed it very much. Great food, good coffee, nice spacious room directly to a beautiful courtyard. Are we coming back? Indeed!
reviews.title: Best hotel I have ever stayed at...

reviews.text: I booked this Riad at the beginning of October for six nights with my sister and Mother to celebrate her birthday and we had a wonderful stay. This was the most luxurious Riad that we stayed at with well equipped comfortable rooms that have a lot of character in a quiet location. The staff were very attentive and helpful, offering a warm welcome and aiding us with all our requests. The Riad is beautiful and very well maintained with lovely detailing in the architecture. You couldn't help but notice the small details that make a difference. Generous breakfasts, lovely bath oils and fresh fruit in the bedroom. I would firmly recommend this Riad to anyone considering a genuine Moroccan welcome at the heart of the Medina.
reviews.title: An oasis of calm amongst the bustle of Marrakech

reviews.text: I stayed at Riad al Loune over a long weekend with some friends. We took two rooms, the Rose room as a twin and also the brown room. Both rooms opened out onto the pool and were absolutely gorgeous. Everything we needed was there, including shower gels, cotton wool buds, fresh towels every day and an unlimited supply of fresh and dried fruits, nuts and local sweets! We were lucky enough to have the riad to ourselves for most of the time and the staff Youseff and the ladies that looked after us couldn't have been more helpful.
reviews.title: The perfect place to stay away from the madness of central Marrakech

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I am afraid this is likely to be a long review. Lots to report.
reviews.title: Magical riad

reviews.text: Firstly the riad. It is truly delightful, a real haven from the madness of the soukh. Gorgious bedrooms with wonderfully comfortable beds covered in the highest quality of - we think - Egyptian cotton. Decor is delightful and at times inspired. Mohamed, his wife and the staff could not be nicer or more helpful and we can certainly see where the previous reviewers are all coming from. Breakfast is a real treat, especially if the weather is not too inclement and it can be taken on the rooftop terrace. The public spaces are also wonderful. Yes five out of five.
reviews.title: Lovely place, great breakfast on the rooftop terrace
Beautifull Riad with outstanding service
reviews.text: However the four of us - staying in separate lovely rooms - all felt that the wondrous riad though has some negatives also which we wondered whether even to mention. However, for the sake of balance, it is better that potential visitors are fully aware.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly the riad - unusually in our experience - is dry and they do not serve alcohol, despite their very best efforts to secure a permit. This could be a major setback for some, who like us love to relax on the rooftop terraces of Marrakech riads with a bottle of delicious and very cold white Moroccan wine. And some wine or a cold beer with our meals were also missed. That having been said, the food here is delicious and you must sample at least one main meal.
reviews.title: Magical

reviews.text: The second negative, is the position of the riad which is the longest walk we have ever had to make from the Djmaa el Fnaa, especially because you cannot really avoid a very long stretch of soukh, which at times can be very slow work. Going in the other direction the first point at which you can get a drive or a taxi is equally far away. This could be reversed into an asset if you want to get lost spiritually into the depths of the medina.
reviews.title: Amazing!

description: The Riad is located in Marrakech Medina's heart, a few steps from the Ben Yousseph Madrassa;few minutes walking distance from Djemaa el Fna square. The Riad has 7 rooms ( with air conditioning/heating, bathtub/shower, hairdryer),solarium,swimming pool,hammam, SPA (massages etc), relax zone,indoor moroccan dinners and parties on request (local food, music,dance).Upon request airport pick-up and drop-off.Walks and guided tours.Wi-fi ADSL.
